item.title: Motion and calculus
item.description: Motions If you studied physics, one of the first things you probably did was graph the “motion” of objects. That is the displacement, velocity, and acceleration at an instant t. Observation Let’s say we have an object whos displacement is such that: $$ s(t) = t^2 \quad \text{where t is the time} $$ If we graphed this function, we’d get a parabola: Now, let’s graph its velocity. You can do it manually, but if you try to feel it, you’ll see that since as the time goes by the displacement keeps on increasing faster and faster, the velocity could increase linearly.
